metadata.title: CVE-2024-11003 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Qualys discovered that needrestart, before version 3.8, passes unsanitizeddata to a library (Modules::ScanDeps) which expects safe input. This couldallow a local attacker to execute arbitrary shell commands. Please see therelated CVE-2024-10224 in Modules::ScanDeps.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-11003` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

needrestart - 3.1-1ubuntu0.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: needrestart package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.1-1ubuntu0.1+esm1').
